reviews.text: What makes it such a crowd-pleaser is that [Rian] Johnson also expresses a reassuring optimism that human decency will prevail, and that justice will favor the hard-working and good-hearted over the pernicious and self-serving.
reviews.author: Noel Murray

reviews.text: Ultimately, Knives Out works because the mystery works. The all-star cast is just icing on the cake-a sweet, creamy icing.
reviews.author: Alan Ng

reviews.text: Will keep you guessing. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Abigail Camarillo

reviews.text: Deception-or, rather, misperception-is built into the film's very form
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: On the performance front, the Knives Out show is comprehensively stolen - and never once returned - by a wired, inspired and kookily amusing Daniel Craig.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: Writer-director Rian Johnson brilliantly keeps the game afoot. Edited with dash and panache, his ingenious plotting keeps you pretty much hooked throughout a playful 130 minutes.
reviews.author: Larushka Ivan-Zadeh

reviews.text: Knives Out not only brings back this breed of manor house murder mystery - last a cult hit with the 1980s-era "Clue" - but proves that the current climate may be ripe for a full-scale modern revival.
reviews.author: Ani Bundel

reviews.text: A fresh, funny, intricate whodunnit which deserves to be experienced by audiences that have no idea what they're getting into.
reviews.author: Scott Wampler

reviews.text: Knives Out is Thanksgiving entertainment for those seething at their relatives over the turkey carcass.
reviews.author: Richard von Busack

reviews.text: The film is a magician's trick so thoroughly satisfying, you have no choice but to give in to its mischievous entreaties. You won't have a better time in the cineplex this year.
reviews.author: Piers Marchant

reviews.text: With an energised Johnson orchestrating an enthusiastic group of actors and a crew that's acing it on almost every level, it seems like cutting loose was exactly the right road to take.
reviews.author: Richard Jordan

reviews.text: It's too absorbingly suspenseful to be just a comedy, but it's witty.
reviews.author: Tim Appelo

reviews.text: Knives Out deserves to be explored as a world of it own, as Johnson balances moral conscience and black humor expertly within the constraints of the murder-mystery genre.
reviews.author: John Wenzel

reviews.text: I'd argue that one mystery remains: Why can't more films be this much fun?
reviews.author: Chris Knight

reviews.text: Rian Johnson's Knives Out is one of the best theatrical experiences to see with an audience this year.
reviews.author: Lauren Veneziani

reviews.text: The movie is probably a little too long, as [Rian] Johnson can't resist piling on more and more preposterous convolutions. But the atmosphere and acting made it hard for me to decide what I'd want him to cut from it.
reviews.author: M.V. Moorhead

reviews.text: Despite the story's many incidental pleasures, it never really takes off.
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: [Rian] Johnson throws in every theatrical prop he can think of and ensures that the film is both as amusing as send-ups like Clue or Murder By Death and as robust as any Christie classic.
reviews.author: Ryan Gilbey

reviews.text: Knives Out isn't revolutionary and falls short of being a post-modern Poirot ... but it's an occasionally bonkers and enjoyable twist on an old tale.
reviews.author: Matt Neal

reviews.text: The movie Knives Out actually turns out to be is a good deal better than the cumbersome, self-satisfied movie that it's aiming towards for the first act.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: [W]hile for all its jauntiness and whimsy, Johnson's script is serious enough to keep us guessing to the end.
reviews.author: Brian Viner

reviews.text: Daniel Craig is terrific leading an all star cast in fiendishly clever and entertaining murder mystery with a whole bag of new tricks that might surprise even Agatha Christie.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: The miracle is that the whole thing doesn't topple into camp - the design ethos might best be described as HP Lovecraft meets Vivienne Westwood - but Johnson knows how stay ahead of an audience.
reviews.author: Tom Shone

reviews.text: Rian Johnson's Knives Out! is a cut above the usual amiable nonsense, and rescues a tired formula with ingenuity and wit.
reviews.author: Paul Whitington

reviews.text: [A] film that, while always likeable and easy watching, is never quite as clever or as funny as it thinks.
reviews.author: Matthew Bond

reviews.text: Rain Johnson's superb thriller Knives Out is an unapologetic love letter to [the] titans of mystery fiction.
reviews.author: Nathanael Hood

reviews.text: A modern murder mystery that delivers on the surprise of a fun mystery and plenty of murder. Rian Johnson crafts one of the year's funniest scripts.
reviews.author: EJ Moreno

reviews.text: It says a lot that one of the year's most entertaining films is also its most straightforward. There's little here except a tight, smart script and a bunch of extremely talented actors.
reviews.author: Jamie East

reviews.text: In a movie that is almost unendingly entertaining, Johnson also slides in some jokes tied to the family's political views. The whole affair is a commentary on the bizarre world of the ultra-wealthy, as well as a morality tale.
reviews.author: Brad Keefe

reviews.text: Sharp and cutting in its not-so-subtle critique of class warfare and ideologies, even as it serves it all up in a rambunctious caper, a hilarious whodunit (or whodonut).
reviews.author: Joel Mayward

reviews.text: Nefariously enjoyable, a comedic whodunit that will keep you guessing until the very end.
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: Built upon a wittily verbose script that delivers more laugh-out-loud lines than most of the year's alleged comedies, Knives Out retains a beating human heart into which daggers are regularly plunged.
reviews.author: Mark Kermode

reviews.text: The characters are distinct for their casting but also the splenetic performance styles, a range of American popinjays heavy on the ham including the riotous multi-leveled self-caricature of Daniel Craig's Poirot-puncturing Benoit Blanc.
reviews.author: Ray Pride

reviews.text: Throat-slashing, backstabbing and all kinds of pointed jabs are thrust to the hilt in "Knives Out," but it's the whodunit's lacerating comedy that slices to the bone. Bloody good, I'd say.
reviews.author: Al Alexander

reviews.text: [It] wears its influences without the tedium of pastiche or the tension-sapping laziness of parody.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: Knives Out's most distinctive feature is its overwhelming sense of its own cleverness.
reviews.author: PJ Nabarro

reviews.text: An apparent suicide serves as the device for everyone to show up at a family compound large enough for nooks, crannies and spaces worthy of a virtual "Clue" game . . . with a wink, wink here and an appropriately satirical musical cue there.
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: The cast looks like they were having a great time making it. Viewers should have similar fun watching it.
reviews.author: Daniel M. Kimmel

reviews.text: A beautifully written, superbly directed and deliciously acted thriller that's alive to the pleasures of the mystery genre.
reviews.author: Matthew Turner

reviews.text: It's pure pleasure.
reviews.author: Jason Bailey

reviews.text: Decorating the action with brown wood and rep-theatre costumery, [Johnson] makes no concessions to safety in his vigorous hammering of the accelerator.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: Rian Johnson has taken the coziest, tropiest of genres and used it to tell a story about America-and he's made my favorite movie since Mad Max: Fury Road.
reviews.author: Leah Schnelbach

reviews.text: Really, the only thing that keeps Knives Out from that most elite tier of renowned cinema is that it is so intentionally anti-elitist. Giving it an A+ would feel like missing the point.
reviews.author: Ryan Syrek

reviews.text: There's a great deal of lively and funny shenanigans with poisons and antidotes, and Johnson delivers a stab of cheerful cynicism.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: [C]inematic legerdemain as its cast expertly calibrate their performances so that arch never strays into the certain disaster of becoming artificial. The result is a giddily entertaining, emotionally engaging film that sets a new standard for its genre.
reviews.author: Andrea Chase

reviews.text: With shrewd plotting and razor-sharp repartee, Knives Out is one of the wittiest films of the year. It might also be one of the most hopeful.
reviews.author: Neil Morris

reviews.text: You hang on every line of dialogue, savor every shot, and wait breathlessly to see where things will go next. The film is pure entertainment from start to finish.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: I had a lot of fun watching this film, it was incredibly entertaining and actually funnier than I expected it to be.
reviews.author: Marianna Neal

reviews.text: A convoluted comic whodunit in which twist is piled upon upon twist and an exceptional cast savors the chance to misdirect us every which way while we enjoy the cunningly goofy ride they take us on.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: However, it's Craig's tenacious, Southern-fried Poirot that steals the show. His broad drawl alone is worth the price of admission as is his exuberance once Benoit sinks his teeth into the case.
reviews.author: Charles Koplinski

reviews.text: An entertainment that's as smart, witty, stylish and exhilarating as any movie lover could wish for.
reviews.author: Joe Morgenstern

reviews.text: "Knives Out" is one of the most entertaining films in theaters this holiday season.
reviews.author: Jonathan W. Hickman

reviews.text: Knives Out is clever, packed with smart twists and turns and is a dose of devilish fun. Whodunit? Rian Johnson, that's who.
reviews.author: Matt Hudson

reviews.text: Filmmaker Rian Johnson knows Agatha Christie's oeuvre so well that he's able to honor it and screw with it too, ripping apart its pieces, moving them around, and making the hoary conventions of the procedural genre feel almost completely fresh and vital.
reviews.author: Jeff York

reviews.text: [Marta] has the unenviable quirk of revealing a lie via projectile vomiting. A device used far too often, across genres, in movies these days.
reviews.author: Wendy Shreve

reviews.text: A sharp, witty and irresistible twist on the popular whodunnit genre.
reviews.author: Linda Marric

reviews.text: ...after a somewhat prolonged setup, the list of suspects start exhibiting their wild personalities, putting this ensemble of legends to work.
reviews.author: Matthew Dougherty

reviews.text: There is a lot of enjoyment to be had in "Knives Out." (Full Content Review for Parents - Violence, Profanity, etc. - also Available)
reviews.author: Teddy Durgin

reviews.text: It's wall-to-wall fun, mystery and mayhem among a wonderful array of obnoxious rich people in this snappy old-school whodunnit...The package comes complete with [enough] twists to keep fans of Agatha Christie, Murder, She Wrote and Columbo very happy.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: This cracking mystery is a lean-forward experience, as the movie lures you deeper and deeper into its intricately plotted layers. In other words - You. Will. Be. Hooked.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: [Rian Johnson's] latest is a satirically malevolent gold mine that refuses to follow the rules of the genre its narrative exists within.
reviews.author: Sara Michelle Fetters

reviews.text: Knives Out is thoroughly watchable entertainment that never lets the social commentary overpower the fun. More a howdunnit than a whodunnit, it'll have you scratching your head and trying to second-guess actions right up until the end.
reviews.author: James Mottram

reviews.text: I suspect that Johnson, an adolescent genre enthusiast to his core, has waited since age 10 to make a movie like this. His enjoyment is contagious, even for those of us who don't think Knives Out quite hits its marks.
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: All the ingredients are cooked to perfection and viewers might struggle to find a weak link in this lean cut mystery.
reviews.author: Millicent Thomas

reviews.text: If you are a fan of the classic style of murder-mystery whodoneits - Knives out, with a brilliant cast and sharp writing, is a brilliant effort by director/writer Rian Johnson.
reviews.author: Bill Watters

reviews.text: Knives Out is too long and some of the characters get lost along the way, but overall it's good nasty fun, clever enough that you cannot call it mindless but so accessible that just about everyone can enjoy the ride.
reviews.author: Robert W. Butler

reviews.text: To be frank, it works sublimely.
reviews.author: Jack King

reviews.text: It's not sharp enough to be in the awards-season discussion, but Knives Out is a deliciously fun night out at the movies.
reviews.author: Tom Santilli

reviews.text: Knives Out is an enticing addition to Johnson's filmography and a welcome appetizer before he goes back into orbit for more Star Wars adventures.
reviews.author: Brandy McDonnell

reviews.text: Knives Out is a whole lot of fun, intended to keep the audience off-balance right up until the finish. It's a razor-sharp throwback from writer-director Rian Johnson.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: It's a murder mystery with colorful characters and a central location - but it unfolds into something more complicated and immediately relevant, creating a story that's been dazzlingly updated for a modern audience.
reviews.author: Karen Han

reviews.text: Even though Knives Out ultimately brings its mystery to a satisfying conclusion with a culprit named and cuffed, there's another one that gets away clean: white guilt.
reviews.author: Joshua Rivera

reviews.text: Knives Out is a film for lovers of murder mysteries, fans of dysfunctional family dramedies and everyone who just loves great movies.
reviews.author: James Croot

reviews.text: An all-round whodunitwhathappened good time.
reviews.author: Abbie Bernstein

reviews.text: As Thanksgiving movies go, Knives Out is a feast of witty performances, clever writing and wicked satire for the whole (13-plus) family.
reviews.author: Annlee Ellingson

reviews.text: A witty whodunnit that brings a breath of fresh air to an otherwise stale genre.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: Shedding his James Bond intensity, Craig plays Blanc with well-timed goofiness, talking in circles and leaving the audience wondering (in a good way) if he is solving anything, or just likes to listen to himself.
reviews.author: Kim Campbell

reviews.text: Johnson's fancy style remains as appealing as ever, though his signature stylistic moves -- the rapid pans, the close-ups from low angles, the tricks with focus -- are by now as recognizable as the line of a cartoonist.
reviews.author: Jake Wilson

reviews.text: A viciously droll game of movie Cluedo, the murder mystery dusted off for the modern age.
reviews.author: Danny Leigh

reviews.text: In the hands of Craig at his most gleeful, de Armas at her career best, and Johnson oozing love for the genre, Knives Out rises splendidly to the task.
reviews.author: David Sims

reviews.text: The colorful character quirks and unexpected plot twists add up to a highly-enjoyable evening at the theater.
reviews.author: Sean O'Connell

reviews.text: Johnson has fun with his screenplay, giving this talented group of actors their scenes of high drama and bad behavior.
reviews.author: PG Staff

reviews.text: A fresh Agatha Christie-type whodunnit highlighted by a sparkling performance by Daniel Craig. I truly hated to see it end.
reviews.author: Tony Medley

reviews.text: Mildly entertaining Clue-like outing with a disappointing role for Daniel Craig. Can I see Murder on the Orient Express instead?
reviews.author: James Verniere

reviews.text: Greed is definitely good when it's this funny.
reviews.author: Steve Davis

reviews.text: It's a worthy and loving homage to great detective stories, and also a biting satire on contemporary American politics and the hubris of the nouveau riche who forget that they never actually worked for the money they so eagerly and ignorantly protect.
reviews.author: Shelagh Rowan-Legg

reviews.text: The script by [Rian] Johnson does what it needs to,. with just the right amount of red herrings, plot twists and deft humor.
reviews.author: Tom Meek

reviews.text: This is nothing but fun from start to finish.
reviews.author: Jonathan Roberts

reviews.text: With a huge ensemble of A-list talent, a razor-sharp screenplay and a head-spinning number of shocks and surprises, Johnson adheres to genre conventions while simultaneously spinning them into something more complex, more devious, and more hilarious.
reviews.author: Brent Hankins

reviews.text: Johnson is a stylist specializing in characters who are smarter than the genres in which they appear, but both he and the cast make it all look so easy.
reviews.author: Alan Zilberman

reviews.text: Knives Out is so fun that you don't even want to think about its flaws.
reviews.author: Hannah Lynn

reviews.text: A heck of a lot of murderous fun.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: Leave it to Johnson, who managed to piece together one of the most compelling Star Wars movies with The Last Jedi, to construct a nearly perfect murder mystery.
reviews.author: Karl Delossantos

reviews.text: [A] wholly original, adult-oriented Hollywood comedy which relies neither on raunchy schtick nor flaccid improv.
reviews.author: Oscar Goff

reviews.text: What a kick to watch whip-smart director Rian Johnson shake the cobwebs off the whodunit genre and turn it intro terrific, twisted, all-star fun that actually does keep you guessing until the deliciously slippery end.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: Looper director Johnson's clever, funny, and star-studded film subverts and elevates the mansion murder mystery genre with aplomb.
reviews.author: Thom Ernst

reviews.text: In the end, what's most fun about "Knives Out" is how fresh it feels.
reviews.author: Chris Hewitt

reviews.text: The plot whips along at such a pace you can feel the wind in your face, but it is also so tight that you never feel the need to even once glance back.
reviews.author: David Jenkins

reviews.text: It's one of the best movies of the year, and one of the most purely enjoyable, as well.
reviews.author: Linda Holmes

reviews.text: In an industry that often dumbs you down, Knives Out raises your IQ.
reviews.author: Cameron Meier

reviews.text: Simply put, Knives Out is one of the best films of Rian Johnson's career, and one of the best mysteries in a very long time.
reviews.author: Johnny Gayzmonic

reviews.text: Though by no means groundbreaking, Knives Out is a charming addition in the popular cozy mystery subgenre.
reviews.author: David Harris

reviews.text: For all its faults, Knives Out is still a moderately enjoyable ride; it's brisk and often engaging, even with a substantial running time of 130 minutes.
reviews.author: Josh Martin

reviews.text: The breakout is the Cuban-born Ana de Armas, who brings wit and fire to the role of Marta, the lamb in the den of vipers, and a character so refreshingly honest that lying makes her puke.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: Rian Johnson's Knives Out is an ingenious whodunit that lets us laugh at rich assholes - in this case, those of House Thrombey - and root for a protagonist who is authentically delightful.
reviews.author: Erica Ciccarone

reviews.text: For those looking for a well-crafted good time, the movie more than delivers.
reviews.author: Christopher Llewellyn Reed

reviews.text: With Knives Out, Johnson has resurrected the whodunnit for the modern age and injected it with topical subjects while also remaining true to the form that he so clearly admires.
reviews.author: Rob Dean

reviews.text: Perhaps Knives Out is a bit of a predictable ride, but it's one worth taking - with all of your adult friends and siblings. This one's not for kids.
reviews.author: Tania Lamb

reviews.text: Ultimately, Knives Out is yet another film which demonstrates that Rian Johnson is one of the smartest most interesting directors currently working in Hollywood.
reviews.author: Kimberly Pierce

reviews.text: The cast, their script, the wild and wonderful twists and turns of this finely-tuned and expertly executed plot, it's just all such an enormous ingenious unguessable giggle and I simply cannot wait to watch it again.
reviews.author: Kate Rodger

reviews.text: Family feuds are only fun when you're watching them, and this one is a blast -- a smart, funny ensemble cast delivering a surprisingly poignant kick in the tail.
reviews.author: Tom Bond

reviews.text: A really good movie, with some comedic moments and good beats...it's a great cast, and I found myself really enjoying this movie.
reviews.author: Kristian Harloff

reviews.text: It's almost unfair that Knives Out is as entertaining and enjoyable as it is, because any future murder mystery movies will forever have to live up to how high Rian Johnson sets the bar here with his latest effort.
reviews.author: Heather Wixson

reviews.text: A genre savant, Johnson understands that one of the pleasures of mystery stories is how they turn viewers into detectives, eager amateur sleuths who also sift through the clues, false and not.
reviews.author: Manohla Dargis

reviews.text: Without sacrificing any of the fun and thrills of a murder mystery, Johnson toys with the basic structure and expectations of a well-worn genre.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: Knives Out is best experienced knowing as little as possible. It is also best experienced with a large crowd, because there are few things as enjoyable as laughing or gasping or wincing along with a few hundred people in the dark.
reviews.author: Norman Wilner

reviews.text: Offers multiple levels of engagement and enjoyment; it's just that it's always hinting at the superior film it might have been.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: Knives Out isn't just a beautifully made diversion. It's also a utopian vision.
reviews.author: Stephanie Zacharek

reviews.text: Rian Johnson takes a stellar ensemble cast, then plunges them headfirst into a mystery that would make Agatha Christie swoon.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: "Knives Out" is as much a 'toon as it is a hat tip to the elaborate mechanics of an Agatha Christie mystery. It's silly and suspenseful in equal measure.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: Johnson has crafted a wonderfully jumbled tale of family and murder that pays homage to murder mysteries and is effortlessly entertaining.
reviews.author: Micheal Compton

reviews.text: It's a film filled with feints, bobs and weaves designed to throw you off the scent, earning every minute spent up onscreen.
reviews.author: Steven Sheehan

reviews.text: One of the insights writer-director Johnson brings to the movie is a political and cultural awareness of what is going on in today's society - a denigration and suspicion of outsiders.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: The captivating 'Knives Out' is a cutting-edge whodunit.
reviews.author: Roger Tennis

reviews.text: Cuts its way to a top spot among the best films of 2019 with a terrific ensemble, a smart script and masterful direction.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: Knives Out is a trite, pale comedy that tries to be as infantile as it can be within the bounds of adult entertainment.
reviews.author: Paddy Kehoe

reviews.text: I left not caring what the future held for a single one of these characters.
reviews.author: Michael Smith

reviews.text: The story is clever enough to keep you on your toes, and a fantastic cast fills in all the gaps, with especially enjoyable performances from [Chris] Evans and [Daniel] Craig.
reviews.author: Josh Terry

reviews.text: [Johnson] brilliantly reinvented crime noir with a high-school bent in his 2006 directorial debut "Brick," and "Knives Out" marries the problem-solving of Sherlock and Columbo with the nuttiness of "Clue."
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: [Rian] Johnson delivers what Knives Out promises: wry amusement, a mystery resolved at the last moment, and enough snide observation to justify the appropriately caustic treatment these characters so richly deserve.
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: Rian Johnson drags the whodunit kicking and screaming into the 21st century with the sort of breezy glee that only an enthusiast of the genre could muster.
reviews.author: Andrew Wyatt

reviews.text: It's not nail-biting stuff, more of a filmed play at times, but Johnson guides the feature into some intriguing areas of behavior, and a few near-misses are fun.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: This is a classic murder mystery caper with a facetious postmodern point of view; it looks and feels timeless and yet its voice is quintessentially 2019.
reviews.author: Jennifer Heaton

reviews.text: "Knives Out" deftly takes classic elements of the whodunit genre and sees Rian Johnson give it a really clever new spin. Daniel Craig, Ana de Armas, and Chris Evans shine.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: One of the funniest movies this year, but also a genius bit of writing and filmmaking we don't get to see as often as most critics would like.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: It is deliciously nasty, seasoned with some political jibes, a ton of fun and anything but cozy.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: The cast, the clues, and the comedy fit together like perfect puzzle pieces in quick-witted whodunit Knives Out.
reviews.author: André Hereford

reviews.text: Great, galloping fun---the year's most entertaining movie puzzle, with some of the sharpest edges where you least expect them.
reviews.author: Neil Pond

reviews.text: The kind of movie they say they don't make anymore, it's a smashing, old fashioned entertainment with a saucy, contemporary edge.
reviews.author: Sean Burns

reviews.text: A fresh spin on old-fashioned fun, and deserves to be witnessed by all who appreciate the medium
reviews.author: Peter Gray

reviews.text: Don't fear: No spoilers here. All you need to know is Knives Out is a devilish delight.
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: ...not as sharp as it could have been, but Knives Out is nonetheless an engaging romp worth taking a stab at.
reviews.author: Anthony O'Connor

reviews.text: An enticing mystery, tight script, and stellar cast deliver in spades. Not only is it one of the best mysteries in eons, Knives Out is hands-down the best film of the year.
reviews.author: Aaron Peterson

reviews.text: Rian Johnson has said that he wouldn't mind exploring further adventures with Blanc... So what are you waiting for? Go out and make Knives Out a hit!
reviews.author: Don Kaye

reviews.text: Okay, I guess, but not at all what the trailers promised. Audiences sold on an ensemble murder mystery, but instead they get a thriller with aggressive political undertones...
reviews.author: Grace Randolph

reviews.text: Given the way the rich keep scheming and plotting against the poor and one another, "Knives Out" proves to be the exact opposite of "Parasite" in every way imaginable.
reviews.author: Martin Tsai

reviews.text: This film is not as clever as it thinks it is, but is highly entertaining -- if not entirely satisfying.
reviews.author: Louisa Moore

reviews.text: Clever, funny and hugely entertaining.
reviews.author: Vicky Roach

reviews.text: Toying with the classic elements of films like Clue, Murder By Death, and the countless Agatha Christie adaptations, Rian Johnson crafts a clever puzzle that is relevant and political.
reviews.author: Sara Clements

reviews.text: [Rian] Johnson has constructed a tightly plotted, superbly acted "escape room" for both his characters and the audience to explore and puzzle over. Most will find the two hours and 10 minutes it takes to solve well worth the price of admission.
reviews.author: Michael Burgin

reviews.text: This incredibly smart and funny film with standout performances from actors who are having as much fun as the viewer is sure to be tops on not just critics' lists, but yours as well.
reviews.author: Pamela Powell

reviews.text: The class warfare picture by way of Agatha Christie that we never knew we needed, but we do, now more than ever.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: "Knives Out" shows the sure hand of a serious talent.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: The fun in "Knives Out" is watching an ensemble of super-serious actors getting to misbehave.
reviews.author: Johnny Oleksinski

reviews.text: The cast of familiar faces overflows with talent. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Daniel de Partearroyo

reviews.text: Once the game is afoot in "Knives Out," its step is never less than light, swift and sure.
reviews.author: Ann Hornaday

reviews.text: An entirely entertaining murder-mystery jape; dryly funny, deliciously retro yet decidedly modern. Whenever you think you've got it figured out, it trips you up again... and you love it for doing so.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: It's a grand piece of star-studded, old-school studio programming, with a mix of ghoulish comedy and of-the-moment politics.
reviews.author: Scott Mendelson

reviews.text: Director Rian Johnson assembles an all-star cast for this modern and humorous mystery that rejiggers all the tropes and trappings of a whodunit in a fun and frothy lens.
reviews.author: Garrett Mitchell

reviews.text: With the ability to make his film truly unique from any number of angles, Johnson instead plays it safe and leaves one wondering why he wanted to tell such a tame story.
reviews.author: Edwin Arnaudin

reviews.text: This murder mystery, which tips its hat to Sherlock Holmes, Edgar Allan Poe, Agatha Christie and Clue, features a sprawling cast of characters, almost all of whom are pegged as up to no good within the film's first twenty minutes.
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: It's exceptional escapist entertainment for those who don't mind a little spice sprinkled into their cozy mystery.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: "Knives Out" is a kick. By the time it was finally revealed whodunit, I just wanted to start over and play again.
reviews.author: Moira MacDonald

reviews.text: Knives Out is a reminder that one can indeed have fun at the movies!
reviews.author: Rosalie Kicks

reviews.text: Johnson flays layer after layer of socio-political intrigue as he twists the knife ... via an old school Jessica Fletcher-esque whodunit. Frankly, Knives Out is quite possibly the most fun you'll have at the theater this holiday season.
reviews.author: Douglas Davidson

reviews.text: Thanks to a terrific ensemble cast, irreverent sensibilities, and a push for incorporating the modern world, Knives Out is more than a quirky thriller with an eye towards the past.
reviews.author: Aaron Neuwirth

reviews.text: "[Craig] sprinkles all 11 herbs and spices onto his Kentucky-fried accent, and while it may prove a bit much for some, it cleverly anchors the film's tone: very humorous, a bit preposterous, but always consistent."
reviews.author: Liam Maguren

reviews.text: This film is super satisfying. It's funny, the mystery plot really works, and it also has something to say, which it does with enjoyably righteous anger. Go for the production design and the plot, leave being blown away by De Armas.
reviews.author: CJ Johnson

reviews.text: Knives Out is an engaging and fun whodunit story, complete with excellent writing and a stellar ensemble cast.
reviews.author: Sheraz Farooqi

reviews.text: Rian Johnson's Knives Out is endlessly entertaining from its twisty and captivating story to its stellar cast and subtle humor.
reviews.author: Amanda Mazzillo

reviews.text: It is a great cast, but mostly underutilized... It had a lot of interesting elements -- looking like an "Eye Spy" book come to life -- but it wasn't quite sharp enough, if you will.
reviews.author: Lael Loewenstein

reviews.text: I like it, but I don't love it. It wants to be an Agatha Christie film and it's setup is pretty spot on, but it's payoff is pretty clumsy.
reviews.author: Wade Major

reviews.text: Though earnest in its full embrace of whodunit tropes and unabashed tonal excesses, the hilarious ensemble piece capitalizes on its many qualities that will garner mass appeal.
reviews.author: Carlos Aguilar

reviews.text: If you liked "Clue" - the quintessential murder mystery of the '80s - you'll be satisfied with "Knives Out" which is filled with an equally eccentric ensemble played by A-listers.
reviews.author: Kirsten Acuna

reviews.text: Knives Out is Razor sharp! Writer/Director Rian Johnson has assembled a rogues gallery of a lovable hateful family played by A-listers who feasted on this project. This is Rian Johnson's homage to Agatha Christie
reviews.author: Linda and Al Lerner

reviews.text: A fun twist on the Agatha Christie whodunit that mocks the genre while indulging in all the reasons why we like it.
reviews.author: Christopher Lloyd

reviews.text: Who knew murder could be this much fun?
reviews.author: Joanna Langfield

reviews.text: This film is just flat out fun.
reviews.author: Max Weiss

reviews.text: A modern take on a classic brand of storytelling, "Knives Out" is incredibly well crafted and endlessly entertaining.
reviews.author: Greg Maki

reviews.text: Sumptuous and diverting...
reviews.author: Anthony Lane

reviews.text: Like a clever piece of stage conjuring, "Knives Out" is slight but hugely enjoyable.
reviews.author: Jonathan Romney

reviews.text: Enjoyed the first two acts, the last act felt sloppy.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: It's a charming, eccentric, prudent puzzler that is brave enough to become all the more thrilling.
reviews.author: Annie Banks

reviews.text: With everybody busy hiding something, ignorance is half the bliss of this comedic riff on classic whodunits.
reviews.author: Andiee Paviour

reviews.text: "Knives Out" plays fast and it plays farcical, but it also plays fair. Most of all, it plays like a dream.
reviews.author: Ty Burr

reviews.text: Maybe I'm just jaded, but to me, there isn't a genuine thrill in sight. Still, I found it an enjoyable enough way to pass the time between clichés.
reviews.author: Rex Reed

reviews.text: There's not a weak link in this entire cast.
reviews.author: Chris Stuckmann

reviews.text: A frothy whodunit, '70s style, with a cast of today's A-list stars. Great fun.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: Rian Johnson spins another wildly entertaining story that defies genre tropes, all the while giving plenty of familiar faces a ton of room to do what they do best, reminding us why we love them all in the first place.
reviews.author: Nick Kush

reviews.text: Writer-director Rian Johnson's fizzy Agatha Christie riff "Knives Out" succeeds as a throwback with more than mere nostalgia on its mind.
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: With a star-studded cast and written and directed by filmmaker, Rian Johnson, Knives Out should have been a no brainer hit.
reviews.author: Allison Rose

reviews.text: With its narrative double bluffs and knowingly byzantine plot twists, Knives Out nimbly swerves around the pitfalls of murder mysteries past. Full of rhythmic verve and pithy humor, this is uproariously entertaining filmmaking.
reviews.author: Christina Newland

reviews.text: A sensational film that brilliantly mixes humor and mystery. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mikel Zorrilla

reviews.text: There's nuance dripping like venom from thirsty fangs all over the performance stage of Johnson's cinematic charade.
reviews.author: Don Shanahan

reviews.text: There's no one on earth, or even in the movies, who talks quite the way the people in Knives Out do, but we become conversant in their idiosyncratic patois by listening to it and learning the rules of this stylized fictional world.
reviews.author: Dana Stevens

reviews.text: Loaded with irreverent humour and a cavalcade of magnificent performances, this darkly comedic caper is a deliriously fabulous ride you won't want to end.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: A renowned narrative format honoured yet subverted, a plot that is intelligent but not smug, an all-star cast that is perfectly balanced, giving performances that range from venomous to vulnerable yet are all rip-roaringly funny.
reviews.author: Laura Potier

reviews.text: The characters are kooky and the twists surprising, which makes for a really good time at the theater.
reviews.author: Rachel Wagner

reviews.text: "Knives Out" is witty and has an ace performance from Daniel Craig, but the mystery and big reveal left me underwhelmed.
reviews.author: Nate Adams

reviews.text: Knives Out leads viewers on a thrilling and wickedly fun ride as the entire ensemble offers breathtaking performances in this whodunnit mystery.
reviews.author: Molly Freeman

reviews.text: Rian Johnson once again subverts expectations to tremendous success.
reviews.author: Evan Dossey

reviews.text: With rich-families-in-crisis shows like 'Succession' becoming phenomenons, this film has potential to make a big splash at the box office. And it's good, too, which is always something.
reviews.author: Megan McLachlan

reviews.text: Thanks to the killer ensemble, Johnson still deals up a kind of alternative event escapism, one that deals in star-power and smarm that is so often missing from the cineplexes.
reviews.author: Matt Oakes

reviews.text: A fun thrill ride from beginning to end. Johnson's fresh spin on the classic whodunit formula delivers the right amount of laughs and surprises. A breakout performance from Ana de Armas. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Rene Sanchez

reviews.text: The contradictions at the heart of Johnson's politics make this an ultimately frustrating addition to the mystery genre.
reviews.author: Andrew Emerson

reviews.text: What's that I hear? It's 'as if millions of voices suddenly cried out in terror and were suddenly silenced.' The sound of deflated haters never sounded so sweet as seeing Rian Johnson's The Last Jedi followup, the wildly hilarious whodunit Knives Out.
reviews.author: Robert Daniels

reviews.text: Knives Out is that great story, told by someone with great imagination and at the top of his game. This might be the most fun film you'll see this year.
reviews.author: Dan Barnes

reviews.text: Knives Out is absolutely incredible. It honors the murder mystery genre, subverts it, injects on-point political commentary, and most importantly, is one of the most flat-out ******* entertaining movies all year
reviews.author: Robert Kojder

reviews.text: It's a fun and at times very amusing fresh take on the usual period genre films.
reviews.author: Katie Hogan

reviews.text: Hugely hilarious entertainment and delivers just what the trailer laid out to fulfill our wildest expectations.
reviews.author: Jazz Tangcay

reviews.text: Knives Out is a WhoDunIt thriller with an outstanding cast, an enthralling mystery, and it is directed/communicated exhilaratingly well.
reviews.author: Jason Escamilla

reviews.text: Part Agatha Christie, part The Pink Panther,Knives Outis driven by its comically devious, delusional array of suspects and its southern fried detective.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: Knives Out is an absolutely audacious but terrifically entertaining romp that's filled with suspense and plenty of twists and turns to keep you guessing throughout.
reviews.author: Nicola Austin

reviews.text: [T]he film plays around with the tropes of the genre while skilfully creating a riveting mystery of its own, one that functions in part as a sly, satirical take-down of Make America Great Again-style thinking.
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: Touching at times, this neatly wrapped tale about immigrants, upper class entitlement and Trumpian politics flawlessly refreshes the murder-mystery genre.
reviews.author: Eammon Jacobs

reviews.text: It's enjoyable to watch these privileged snobs squirm.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: More so than The Last Jedi, Knives Out firmly establishes Johnson as one of the most reliable filmmakers working in the mainstream today, subverting the expectations of popcorn entertainment without detracting from the simple pleasures.
reviews.author: Alistair Ryder

reviews.text: Knives Out delighted me to no end and kept me thinking the entire time. With each new twist, I thought I knew who did it and what was going on but then I was shown I couldn't trust a single person and that's the sign of a brilliant mystery.
reviews.author: Rachel Leishman

reviews.text: It's hard to imagine having a better time at the movies this year.
reviews.author: Lindsey Romain

reviews.text: Knives Out is a thrillingly intriguing ride. It's tense and mysterious, Rian Johnsondoes a fantastic job directing a super-tight script.
reviews.author: Ben Rolph

reviews.text: It's an ingeniously constructed film, which is thoroughly modern in its language and filled with so many twists it will make your head spin.
reviews.author: Clarisse Loughrey

reviews.text: A crowd-pleasing alternative from blockbusters and heartwrenching dramas, Johnson's take on a classic albeit outdated genre offers fresh delight for modern audiences.
reviews.author: Katie Smith-Wong

reviews.text: Johnson, on temporary sabbatical from the Star Wars universe after The Last Jedi, has used his time well. Murder he wrote - and what a writer he is.
reviews.author: Charlotte O'Sullivan

reviews.text: There is some savvy subtext in Rian Johnson's writing, about old money and Trump-era values, but mainly this is exceptional cinematic froth, and murder at its most mirthful.
reviews.author: Kevin Maher

reviews.text: An ingeniously constructed, devilishly creative murder-mystery enhanced by a first-rate ensemble cast and some risky, surprising narrative choices.
reviews.author: Shaun Munro

reviews.text: Every time you think you've guessed what's up the writer-director's sleeve, you both have and haven't: the layering, feints, and decoys fox you exactly as he's hoping.
reviews.author: Tim Robey

reviews.text: A glossy, perfectly pitched production, put together with spry style and an equal desire to honour and subvert the tropes of the genre...
reviews.author: Emma Simmonds

reviews.text: Johnson's film is a lot of witty fun, crafted smartly and handsomely-acted, though it's not without its issues.
reviews.author: Nick Johnston

reviews.text: You'll burst out laughing and adore how Johnson's cast plays their cards with confidence, masks their bluffs, and presents a gallery of rogues with enjoyable deceit.
reviews.author: Matt Donato

reviews.text: See Knives Out! You'll laugh, you'll gasp, you'll make your guess and when the two hours and ten minutes is up you'll want to watch it all over again.
reviews.author: Gabriella Geisinger

reviews.text: When it comes to making a movie that's entertaining, thoughtful, sharply written, and undeniably creative, Rian Johnson is guilty as charged.
reviews.author: Rafael Motamayor

reviews.text: Though far from a flawless film, Knives Out is sure to be a crowd-pleaser.
reviews.author: Anna Swanson

reviews.text: A fun and funny whodunit which manages deliver all the classic troupes of the genre while still feeling fresh and new.
reviews.author: Sean Chandler

reviews.text: Bolstered by an all-star cast that entertain in every way, "Knives Out" is a film that brings the charm and the mystery that helped solidify Clue as an iconic film. In the future, I easily see this one standing beside it.
reviews.author: Kate Sánchez

reviews.text: Knives Out is what a good trip to the cinema is all about. It is a witty, surprising, and terrifically performed film from Rian Johnson and an all-star modern classic whodunnit that subverts expectations.
reviews.author: Lewis Knight

reviews.text: More than anything else, Knives Out is just tremendous fun.
reviews.author: Audrey Fox

reviews.text: Knives Out works so well because Rian Johnson knows the clichés and tropes of this particular kind of murder mystery inside out, and understands that his audience knows them too.
reviews.author: James Marsh

reviews.text: The various ways in which [Rian] Johnson keeps you guessing feel fresh and new even in a dusty genre that's been selling airport paperbacks since before there were airports
reviews.author: Ed Travis

reviews.text: Knives Out weaves in some effective commentary on immigration.
reviews.author: Li Lai

reviews.text: Rian Johnson's Knives Out is an engine of perfect entertainment.
reviews.author: Alan Cerny

reviews.text: "Knives Out" is a blast, a mystery confection of good-not-great breeding.
reviews.author: Joe Gross

reviews.text: Knives Out is an effective, entertaining, and contemporary spin on what's no longer a worn-out genre.
reviews.author: Dan Caffrey

reviews.text: Knives Out's brilliant cinematography and the larger-than-life performances of the all-star cast make it stunning in theaters, but it will be an immensely rewatchable film at home, yielding new details with every viewing.
reviews.author: Bea Caicoya

reviews.text: Very imaginative and powerful visuals... the script is written with an amazing precision. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Erick Estrada

reviews.text: What makes Knives Out such a joyful experience (and one that should absolutely be seen with a massive crowd) is the catharsis that comes with its very arch depiction of the toxins that currently poison the American culture.
reviews.author: Chris Feil

reviews.text: Knives Out is a fun and intelligent whodunnit that will keep you guessing to the very end.
reviews.author: Courtney Small

reviews.text: It's a miracle anyone could find a way to breathe invigorating life into the murder mystery film, but thankfully, Rian Johnson is perfect for the job.
reviews.author: Oliver Whitney

reviews.text: Knives Out is a fun and hilarious whodunit with an all-star cast. Rian Johnson knocks it it out of the park managing to deliver clever social commentary on our current society while paying homage to the murder mystery genre.
reviews.author: Sharronda Williams

reviews.text: Knives Out is an absolute blast. It'll appeal to fans of the detective mystery genre, for fans of the astounding cast, or for those that love Rian Johnson's subversively entertaining films.
reviews.author: David Fontana

reviews.text: There are plot twists aplenty, but none add up to much.
reviews.author: Dwight Brown

reviews.text: A hellishly entertaining game. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ruben Peralta Rigaud

reviews.text: It's a silly, sleuthy time at the movies, an autumnal caper and a sure-fire crowd-pleaser.
reviews.author: Meg Shields

reviews.text: Ana de Armas leads Rian Johnson's latest whodunit with the type of role and acting that transforms a career. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Orlando Maldonado

reviews.text: Knives Out is one of a kind. Rian Johnson doesn't hold back delivering big fun and spicy commentary with fiery results. And if you don't already know that Ana de Armas is something special, there's no excuses after this.
reviews.author: Perri Nemiroff

reviews.text: ...the idea of the film really is have a blast in giving us an old-fashioned murder mystery solved in the most old-fashioned way - through the use of the old grey cells. Poirot would approve.
reviews.author: Shubhra Gupta

reviews.text: Knives Out is enjoyable not just due to performance from the likes of Michael Shannon, Toni Collette, and Jamie Lee Curtis, but for the way others play against type.
reviews.author: Andrea Thompson

reviews.text: It's a worthy tribute to Agatha Christie, a light but pointed rebuke, and a delectable time at the movies, too.
reviews.author: Alissa Wilkinson

reviews.text: It lacks Hitchcockian tension or Christie-level dignity, but it's funny, surprising, and intriguing in the way it flips the usual murder-mystery script.
reviews.author: Tasha Robinson

reviews.text: An impeccably-staged, gripping murder mystery in the vein of Agatha Christie.
reviews.author: Christopher Machell

reviews.text: It's such fun to watch a writer-director like Johnson get to play with all the familiar, cozy tropes before throwing everything out the third-story window.
reviews.author: Emma Stefansky

reviews.text: A GREAT murder mystery.
reviews.author: Sarah Marrs

reviews.text: The secret ingredient in Knives Out is its spirit of authentic love for the classic detective stories and Rian Johnson's ability to laugh with the genre and not at it. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: María Fernanda Mugica

reviews.text: Similar to Ready or Not earlier this year, Knives Out is an unabashed commentary on the current state of affairs in America.
reviews.author: Jared Mobarak

reviews.text: Best to remember that those old movies Johnson embraces were really not that great, and to bring lowered expectations to his entertaining but scattershot update.
reviews.author: Caryn James

reviews.text: Through clever plotting and smart sleight of hand, Johnson has crafted a whodunit that's worthy of Agatha Christie or Arthur Conan Doyle, and one that will have audiences guessing until the final few reels.
reviews.author: Chris Tilly

reviews.text: A whodunit awash in twists, turns and rampant cleverness, "Knives Out" is, above all, a celebration of murder mysteries that puts on a fairly nifty impression of one itself.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: Stick with Knives Out and it delivers once all of the puzzle pieces have been picked up and slotted into place.
reviews.author: Matt Maytum

reviews.text: Contemporary but old-fashioned shaped whodunit that both enlivens and refreshes the genre.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: Johnson again infuses his love of cinema and the genre into his work. If nothing else, his clever screenplay showcases how much he enjoys one-way conversation with his audience.
reviews.author: Dustin Chase

reviews.text: Once you clue into the fascinating political undercurrent running beneath Knives Out, a whole other film unlocks itself before your eyes.
reviews.author: Marshall Shaffer

reviews.text: This film is a total bullseye from Johnson who made one of the absolute most fulfilling films of the year. Run, don't walk - KNIVES OUT flat-out rules!
reviews.author: James Clay

reviews.text: By proudly relaying the classic whodunit form, Rian Johnson's Knives Out returns to thrilling glory a genre whose cover has felt blown for a very long time.
reviews.author: Luke Parker

reviews.text: One of the funniest films of the year, this tale of deception and intrigue packs an all-star cast at their very best and some theatrical filmmaking from a technical master
reviews.author: Adam Solomons

reviews.text: Knives Out is a comedy first, a mystery second and a sly political commentary about the 1% a distant third. Thanks to an impeccable script, game actors and plenty of laughs, the messaging goes down easy. This one is a crowd-pleaser.
reviews.author: Joe Lipsett

reviews.text: Knives Out Is The Best Whodunnit Of The Decade
reviews.author: Kristy Puchko

reviews.text: The existence of a movie as original as Knives Out is almost a miracle. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Daniel Martínez Mantilla

reviews.text: A silly, stabby, supremely clever whodunnit that only really suffers from having too little room for each of its talented players to fully register in the film's limited run time.
reviews.author: Leah Greenblatt

reviews.text: Knives Out positions us just where it wants us, comfortably knowing more than any one character until the tumblers fall into place and we realize there's another door, another room that we hadn't even suspected.
reviews.author: David Bax

reviews.text: A deliciously thrilling funhouse of mirth and malice.
reviews.author: Jordan Ruimy

reviews.text: Rian Johnson's Knives Out is a film that is smart and witty, has great world-building and is anchored by great performances from the entire cast.
reviews.author: Britany Murphy

reviews.text: A deliciously wicked murder mystery procedural that uses its superb cast to bring Agatha Christie to 2019 in a fun-filled, intriguing drama
reviews.author: J. Don Birnam

reviews.text: Undoubtedly, one of the year's best original films, if not one of the best studio movies of the year. I haven't had this much fun watching a movie in such a loooooong time.
reviews.author: Rendy Jones

reviews.text: Johnson hasn't just churned out a wink-wink spoof of the classical drawing-room mystery... with its ingenious twists and turns, he has crafted an intricate puzzle-box narrative worthy of the genre's brainiest practitioners.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: Knives Out is a classic whodunit, and doesn't mind who knows it.
reviews.author: Angie Han

reviews.text: This is a dizzy, zippy and surprisingly politically astute murder-mystery comedy that hits all its beats with flair, before turning around and knifing conventional thinking in the back.
reviews.author: Barry Hertz

reviews.text: Something new, surprising and extremely entertaining.
reviews.author: Kambole Campbell

reviews.text: If there's a case for a film that should be experienced purely with an audience, Rian Johnson's "Knives Out" would be a spectacular example. His latest feature is a deliciously entertaining, hysterical whodunit from start to finish.
reviews.author: Adriana Gomez-Weston

reviews.text: A crackling, devious, and hugely satisfying old-school whodunnit with a modern twist...
reviews.author: David Ehrlich

reviews.text: The film rolls and bounces with giddy elation, Johnson and his troupe of actors clearly enjoying themselves as they entertain.
reviews.author: Richard Lawson

reviews.text: Do not expect subtlety; it's the kind of movie that tells you the "game's afoot" twice.
reviews.author: Joshua Rothkopf

reviews.text: Knives Out is one of the year's most entertaining films.
reviews.author: Chris Evangelista

reviews.text: Benoit Blanc is Daniel Craig's next great iconic role. A total blast from beginning to end.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: It's an impeccably constructed roller coaster ride created by a mad (but meticulous) engineer, and when it ends you'll immediately want to get back on.
reviews.author: Adam Chitwood

reviews.text: This, in other words, is one of those mysteries so clever and fiendishly well-engineered that you eventually have no choice but to stop trying to get ahead of it, to simply enjoy the way it plants and payoffs.
reviews.author: A.A. Dowd

reviews.text: Directing a wildly charismatic cast who are all-in on what he's doing, Johnson confidently stays a step or two ahead of his audience, leaving them breathless but satisfied at the end.
reviews.author: Brian Tallerico

reviews.text: The actors' hammy performances only compound the amusement of watching a dynasty propped up by largesse fall to pieces at the very thought of actually having to earn their way in life.
reviews.author: Jake Cole

reviews.text: If you are looking for a good time at the movies this holiday season (perhaps searching for a way to escape the family for a few hours), "Knives Out" is certainly one you shouldn't miss.
reviews.author: Jason Guerrasio

reviews.text: There's so much to love about Rian Johnson's triumph, both as gratuitously enjoyable entertainment and the first film to take on the significance of a President Trump without lapsing into corny preachiness.
reviews.author: Charles Bramesco

reviews.text: Knives Out gives us a hysterical whodunnit for a new generation of movie lovers.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: Murder, Mayhem, Mystery with outrageously quippy dialogue from Rian Johnson makes Knives Out the most fun movie-going experience I've had in ages. A sure throwback to Christie, Clue and Hitchcock in the best way possible.
reviews.author: Carla Renata

reviews.text: Johnson keeps us guessing, which is good, but the thing that makes this a better mousetrap than most isn't the complexity, but the fact he's managed to rig it without the usual cheese.
reviews.author: Peter Debruge

reviews.text: A delicious throwback to the all-star whodunit, this juicy comedy thriller is a treat from start to finish, which should make it a sizeable hit for Lionsgate.
reviews.author: David Rooney

reviews.text: Working from his own original script, Johnson has much fun pulling the strings as well as the rug from underneath us time and time again.
reviews.author: Benjamin Lee

synopsis: The circumstances surrounding the death of crime novelist Harlan Thrombey are mysterious, but there's one thing that renowned Detective Benoit Blanc knows for sure -- everyone in the wildly dysfunctional Thrombey family is a suspect. Now, Blanc must sift through a web of lies and red herrings to uncover the truth.
